message: Hello Bob, I'm excited to discuss the sale of this valuable product with you. I believe it's a great opportunity for both of us to come to a mutually beneficial agreement. I'm willing to start with a price of $1200000. I'm open to negotiations and look forward to hearing your thoughts.
I appreciate your initial offer, but I was thinking more along the lines of $900000. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value and the market conditions.

I understand that you're looking for a good deal, Bob, but I'm afraid $900000 is a bit too low for my comfort. Considering the product's value and the market conditions, I'm willing to meet you halfway at $1100000. I'm confident that this price is still a great opportunity for you to acquire this valuable asset.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, but I'm still a bit higher on the price. I'm thinking more along the lines of $950000. I believe this is a more reasonable price considering the product's value and the market conditions.

I understand that you're still looking for a good deal, Bob, but $950000 is getting closer to my minimum price. However, I'm willing to make one more concession. I'm willing to meet you at $1050000. This is as low as I can go, and I believe it's still a great opportunity for you to acquire this valuable asset.

I appreciate your willingness to make concessions, but I'm still a bit higher on the price. I'm thinking more along the lines of $980000. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value and the market conditions.

I'm starting to get a bit concerned that we're getting close to the end of our negotiations, Bob. I'm willing to make one more significant concession, but I need you to meet me at a price that's closer to my minimum. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $1200000. This is my final offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.

I understand that you're trying to get back to your original offer, but I'm still not comfortable with that price. I'm willing to meet you halfway between our previous offers, so I'll make a counteroffer of $1025000. I believe this is a fair price considering the product's value and the market conditions.

I appreciate your willingness to meet me halfway, Bob, but I'm afraid $1025000 is still a bit too low for my comfort. I'm willing to make one last concession, but I need you to meet me at a price that's closer to my minimum. I'm willing to sell the product to you for $1150000. This is my final offer, and I hope we can come to an agreement.

I understand that we're at the end of our negotiations, but I'm still not comfortable with the price. I'm willing to meet you at $1080000, which is the highest I'm willing to go. If you're not willing to accept this price, I'll have to consider purchasing the product from John for $1500000.
